name: Further relief upon judgment
text:
Further relief based on a declaratory judgment may be granted whenever necessary or proper, after reasonable notice and hearing, against any adverse party whose rights have been adjudicated by the judgment. [L 1921, c 162, §3; RL 1925, §2920; RL 1935, §4222; RL 1945, §9973; RL 1955, §228-3; HRS ; am L 1972, c 89, §1(e)]
Case Notes
  Cited as authorizing the grant of ancillary equitable relief, including relief from forfeiture of lease for breach of covenant.  58 H. 606, 575 P.2d 869.
  Where the court did not adjudicate the rights of any party because the declaratory judgment was voluntarily dismissed, section inapplicable.  103 H. 26, 79 P.3d 119.
